dialogs.original: [Gives paper to FIRST SERVINGMAN]  So many guests inviteas here are writ.
dialogs.translated: [Giving a paper to the FIRST SERVINGMAN] Invite all the guests written on this list.

dialogs.original: [To SECOND SERVINGMAN]  Sirrah, go hire me twenty cunning cooks.
dialogs.translated: [To SECOND SERVINGMAN] Go hire twenty skilled cooks.

dialogs.original: You shall have none ill, sir, for Ill try if they can lick their fingers.
dialogs.translated: I wont hire any bad cooks. Ill test them by making them lick their fingers.

dialogs.original: How canst thou try them so?
dialogs.translated: How does that work?

dialogs.original: Marry, sir, tis an ill cook that cannot lick his own fingers. Therefore he that cannot lick his fingers goes not with me.
dialogs.translated: Well, sir, its a bad cook who refuses to lick his own fingers. So I wont hire any cooks who wont lick their own fingers.

dialogs.original: Go, be gone.
dialogs.translated: Get going.

dialogs.original: We shall be much unfurnished for this time.What, is my daughter gone to Friar Lawrence?
dialogs.translated: We are not going to be prepared for this wedding celebration.

dialogs.original: Ay, forsooth.
dialogs.translated: Yes, thats the truth.

dialogs.original: Well, he may chance to do some good on her.A peevish self-willed harlotry it is.
dialogs.translated: Well, theres a chance he may do her some good. Shes a stubborn good-for-nothing little whore.

dialogs.original: See where she comes from shrift with merry look.
dialogs.translated: Look, shes back from confession looking happier.

dialogs.original: How now, my headstrong? Where have you been gadding?
dialogs.translated: How are you, my headstrong daughter? Where have you been?

dialogs.original: Where I have learned me to repent the sin    Of disobedient opposition    To you and your behests,   and am enjoined    By holy Lawrence to fall prostrate here    To beg your pardon.   [Falls to her knees]    Pardon, I beseech you!    Henceforward I am ever ruled by you.
dialogs.translated: I have been to a place where I learned to repent for the sin of being disobedient to my father and his commands. I am instructed by holy Friar Lawrence to kneel down and beg your forgiveness. [She kneels] Forgive me, I beg you. From now on Ill do what you tell me to.

dialogs.original: Send for the county. Go tell him of this.Ill have this knot knit up tomorrow morning.
dialogs.translated: Send for the Count. Tell him about this. Well move the wedding to tomorrow morning.

dialogs.original: I met the youthful lord at Lawrence cell,And gave him what becomèd love I might, Not stepping oer the bounds of modesty.
dialogs.translated: I met the youthful lord at Lawrences cell. I treated him with all the love I could give without breaking the proper rules of modesty.

dialogs.original: Why, I am glad on t. This is well. Stand up.
dialogs.translated: Im glad! This is good. Stand up.

dialogs.original: This is as t should be.Let me see the county.    Ay, marry, go, I say, and fetch him hither.    Now, afore God, this reverend holy friar!    Our whole city is much bound to him.
dialogs.translated: This is how it should be. I want to see the count. Yes, all right, go, I say, and bring him here. Now, I swear before God, our whole city owes a great deal to this friar.

dialogs.original: Nurse, will you go with me into my closetTo help me sort such needful ornamentsAs you think fit to furnish me tomorrow?
dialogs.translated: Nurse, will you come with me to my room and help me pick out the clothes and jewelry that I should wear tomorrow?

dialogs.original: No, not till Thursday. There is time enough.
dialogs.translated: No, not until Thursday. Theres enough time.

dialogs.original: Go, Nurse. Go with her. Well to church tomorrow.
dialogs.translated: Go, Nurse. Go with her. Well go to the church and have the wedding tomorrow.

dialogs.original: We shall be short in our provision.Tis now near night.
dialogs.translated: We wont have enough food or drink for the party. Its almost night already.

dialogs.original: Tush, I will stir about,    And all things shall be well, I warrant thee, wife.    Go thou to Juliet, help to deck up her.    I'll not to bed tonight. Let me alone.    I'll play the housewife for this once.
dialogs.translated:
Oh hush.
 I'll make sure that the preparations are underway, and everything will be all right.  I promise you that, wife. Go to Juliet, to help get her all dolled up. I won't go to bed tonight. Leave me alone. I'll pretend to be the housewife just this once.
